com.hush.core.security.applet
Class HushEncryptionEngine

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Panel
              java.applet.Applet
                  com.hush.core.security.applet.HushEncryptionEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
EntropyCollectionCallback, Parameterized, PgpConstants, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class HushEncryptionEngine
extends java.applet.Applet
implements EntropyCollectionCallback, Parameterized, PgpConstants

This class provides the functionality of the Hush Encryption Engine in a browser-based environment.

Many of the methods in this class utilize JavaScript callbacks. These methods can be identified by the parameters "onCompletionSuccess" and "onCompletionFailure". These method will exit after spawning off an execution thread. If and when the execution thread exits, a JavaScript function will be called based on whether the operation was successful.

The JavaScript to be called can be submitted inline or by reference. Inline functions are detected by having the key word 'function' as first word. If an inline function is submitted, its body is evaluated as JavaScript after replacing all occurences of certain key words with values.

Example: "function {alert(\"Failed for PARAM_FILE with error: PARAM_FAILURE_REASON\");}"

Referenced functions should be submitted by name and without parantheses and semicolons. They must have a certain prototype of zero or more string valued parameters.

Example: "myFunction""

The parameters that are passed to the JavaScript functions are specified in the documentation for the specific methods.

See Also:
Serialized Form

changeLoginCredentials

public void changeLoginCredentials(java.lang.String oldPassword,
                                   java.lang.String newUsername,
                                   java.lang.String newPassword,
                                   java.lang.String newHostname)
A method to change login credentials on the Hush Key Server Network. Authentication is accomplished using the current login credentials password, which can be retrieved through the getLoginCredentials method.

Note that if any old information is to be kept, it must be re-added here.

Parameters:
oldPassword - the original password
newUsername - the username to be stored
newPassword - the password to be stored
newHostname - the hostname to be stored

collectEntropy

public void collectEntropy(int amount,
                           java.lang.String text1,
                           java.lang.String text2,
                           int sizeX,
                           int sizeY,
                           int bgcolorR,
                           int bgcolorG,
                           int bgcolorB,
                           int textcolorR,
                           int textcolorG,
                           int textcolorB,
                           int fgcolorR,
                           int fgcolorG,
                           int fgcolorB,
                           int graphcolorR,
                           int graphcolorG,
                           int graphcolorB)
Deprecated. 

Pops up an entropy collection panel with two lines of text. The entropy is used to seed or reseed a strong pseudo-random number generator. This should ALWAYS be called before key generation. After entropy collection is completed, the JavaScript function specified by the "onEntropyCollectionCompleted" parameter is called.

Parameters:
amount - the amount of entropy to collect in bytes
text1 - the first line of text to display in the panel
text2 - the second line of text to display in the panel
sizeX - the horizontal size of the panel in pixels
sizeY - the vertical size of the panel in pixels
bgcolorR - the R of the RGB color for the background
bgcolorG - the G of the RGB color for the background
bgcolorB - the B of the RGB color for the background
textcolorR - the R of the RGB color for the text
textcolorG - the G of the RGB color for the text
textcolorB - the B of the RGB color for the text
fgcolorR - the R of the RGB color for the foreground
fgcolorG - the G of the RGB color for the foreground
fgcolorB - the B of the RGB color for the foreground
graphcolorR - the R of the RGB color for the active parts of the graph
graphcolorG - the G of the RGB color for the active parts of the graph
graphcolorB - the B of the RGB color for the active parts of the graph

collectEntropy

public void collectEntropy(int amount,
                           java.lang.String text1,
                           java.lang.String text2,
                           int sizeX,
                           int sizeY,
                           int bgcolorR,
                           int bgcolorG,
                           int bgcolorB,

                           int textcolorG,
                           int textcolorB,
                           int fgcolorR,
                           int fgcolorG,
                           int fgcolorB,
                           int graphcolorR,
                           int graphcolorG,
                           int graphcolorB,
                           java.lang.String callback)
Pops up an entropy collection panel with two lines of text. The entropy is used to seed or reseed a strong pseudo-random number generator. This should ALWAYS be called before key generation.

Parameters:
amount - the amount of entropy to collect in bytes
text1 - the first line of text to display in the panel
text2 - the second line of text to display in the panel
sizeX - the horizontal size of the panel in pixels
sizeY - the vertical size of the panel in pixels
bgcolorR - the R of the RGB color for the background
bgcolorG - the G of the RGB color for the background
bgcolorB - the B of the RGB color for the background
textcolorR - the R of the RGB color for the text
textcolorG - the G of the RGB color for the text
textcolorB - the B of the RGB color for the text
fgcolorR - the R of the RGB color for the foreground
fgcolorG - the G of the RGB color for the foreground
fgcolorB - the B of the RGB color for the foreground
graphcolorR - the R of the RGB color for the active parts of the graph
graphcolorG - the G of the RGB color for the active parts of the graph
graphcolorB - the B of the RGB color for the active parts of the graph
callback - the JavaScript function to call when entropy collection completes

copyUrlToFile

public void copyUrlToFile(java.lang.String url,
                          java.lang.String prompt,
                          java.lang.String defaultFilename,
                          java.lang.String password,
                          java.util.Hashtable parameters,
                          int method,
                          java.util.Hashtable form,
                          boolean decrypt,
                          java.lang.String signature,
                          java.lang.String signerDelimiter,
                          java.lang.String onCompletionSuccess,
                          java.lang.String onCompletionFailure)
Asynchronously copy a URL to a file. Displays a file selection dialog. Supports decryption and signature verification.

Note: If accessing a script to retrieve a file, you can use the following format to force the filename to a name other than that of the script. "http://www.domain.com/test.cgi/filename.txt?key=value"

Keywords for the JavaScript callbacks (see class documentation)
Success: PARAM_FILE, PARAM_VERIFIED_SIGNERS, PARAM_FAILED_SIGNERS
Failure: PARAM_FILE, PARAM_FAILURE_REASON

Parameters:
url - the URL to decrypt
prompt - the prompt to display in the file selection dialog
defaultFilename - the default filename for the file selection dialog
password - attempt to decrypt with this password (may be null)
method - GET or POST (0 or 1)
form - parameters to POST (ignored if method is not POST)
decrypt - try to decrypt the file with the private key and/or specified password
signature - verify the file against this signature; if unspecified will still attempt to verify any signatures embedded in the file
signerDelimiter - when returning the lists of signers, separate each entry with this string
onCompletionSuccess - JavaScript to execute on success
onCompletionFailure - JavaScript to execute on failure

copyUrlToFile2

public void copyUrlToFile2(java.lang.String url,
                           java.lang.String prompt,
                           java.lang.String defaultFilename,
                           java.lang.String password,
                           java.lang.String parameters,
                           int method,
                           java.lang.String form,
                           boolean decrypt,
                           java.lang.String signature,
                           java.lang.String signerDelimiter,
                           java.lang.String onCompletionSuccess,
                           java.lang.String onCompletionFailure)
Asynchronously copy a URL to a file. Displays a file selection dialog.

Identical to copyUrlToFile, except that it accepts the form parameter as a String in the format of a properties file.

Parameters:
url - the URL to decrypt
prompt - the prompt to display in the file selection dialog
defaultFilename - the default filename for the file selection dialog
password - attempt to decrypt with this password
method - GET or POST (0 or 1)
form - parameters to POST (ignored if method is not POST)
decrypt - try to decrypt the file with the private key and/or specified password
signature - verify the file against this signature; if unspecified will still attempt to verify any signatures embedded in the file
signerDelimiter - when returning the lists of signers, separate each entry with this string
onCompletionSuccess - JavaScript to execute on success
onCompletionFailure - JavaScript to execute on failure

doCallback

public void doCallback()
This method is called after entropy collection is completed. It triggers a call to the JavaScript function specified in the "onEntropyCollectionCompleted" applet parameter. It is required to completed the EntropyCollectionCallback interface, and should not be used by third-party developers.

Specified by:
doCallback in interface EntropyCollectionCallback

canEncrypt

public java.lang.String canEncrypt(SecureMessage message)
Determine whether or not a SecureMessage can be encrypted to its recipients, using the information provided by setRecipientAliases and setQuestionsAndAnswers. If a recipient does not have an encryption method available to it on the key server (public key or generated password), and does not have a question and answer specified, it will be returned in the String[].

Parameters:
message - the SecureMessage object with its recipients set
Returns:
a comma separated String containing recipients for which an encryption method is not available

generatePassword

public java.lang.String generatePassword()
Generate a strong random password. To be used in conjunction with the passwordEncryptFile() method. Generate a random password, encrypt a file with it, and then public key encrypt the password. Then, in order to share the file with new recipients, it is only necessary to re-encrypt the password, not the entire file.

Returns:
the password

public java.lang.String passwordDecryptText(java.lang.String encryptedText,
                                            java.lang.String password)
Decrypts a piece of text using the current private key or the given password. (It tries both.) Note: this expects the password to be in the same character encoding as the plain text of the message.

Parameters:
encryptedText - the encrypted text.
password - the password for decryption.
Returns:
the decrypted text.

the encrypted text.

recoverPassphrase

public java.lang.String recoverPassphrase(java.lang.String alias,
                                          java.lang.String component)
Recover a passphrase. If the passphrase is split between the user, the customer and Hush, this method will recover a lost passphrase by supplying either the component held by the user or the customer.

Parameters:
alias - java.lang.String Alias to recover passphrase for.
component - java.lang.String Hexencoded component supplied.
Returns:
String The passphrase recovered.

retrieveShadows

public java.util.Vector retrieveShadows()
If a changePassphrase request involves splitting a passphrase into shadows, this returns the set of two shadows, either of which can be used in combination with one other shadow to reconstruct the passphrase. One shadow is stored on the Hush Key Server Network.

Returns:
a Vector of String valued shadows, null if none were created

sendFileToUrlWithSecureMessage

public void sendFileToUrlWithSecureMessage(java.lang.String url,
                                           java.lang.String prompt,
                                           SecureMessage message,
                                           java.lang.String fileParameterName,
                                           java.lang.String filenameParameterName,
                                           java.lang.String form,

                                           java.lang.String signatureParameterName,
                                           boolean forceEncrypt,
                                           java.lang.String onCompletionSuccess,
                                           java.lang.String onCompletionFailure)
Asynchronously copy a file to a URL. Displays a file selection dialog. Supports encryption and signing.

Success: PARAM_FILE
Failure: PARAM_FILE, PARAM_FAILURE_REASON

Parameters:
url - the URL to which the file will be posted
prompt - the prompt to display in the file selection dialog
message - the SecureMessage object to encrypt
fileParameterName - the form variable in which the file will be placed

signatureParameterName - the form variable in which the signature will be placed
forceEncrypt - if neither aliases nor password are specified, throw an exception (don't send plain text)

onCompletionFailure - JavaScript to execute on failure

                          java.lang.String password,
                          java.lang.String fileParameterName,
                          java.lang.String filenameParameterName,
                          java.util.Hashtable form,
                          boolean sign,
                          java.lang.String signatureParameterName,
                          boolean forceEncrypt,
                          java.lang.String onCompletionSuccess,
                          java.lang.String onCompletionFailure)
Asynchronously copy a file to a URL. Displays a file selection dialog. Supports encryption and signing.

Keywords for the JavaScript callbacks (see class documentation)
Success: PARAM_FILE
Failure: PARAM_FILE, PARAM_FAILURE_REASON

Parameters:
url - the URL to which the file will be posted
prompt - the prompt to display in the file selection dialog
aliases - encrypt the file to these public keys (may be null)
password - encrypt the file with this password (may be null)
fileParameterName - the form variable in which the file will be placed
filenameParameterName - the form variable in which the file name will be placed
form - parameters to POST (ignored if method is not POST)
sign - sign the file with the current private key
signatureParameterName - the form variable in which the signature will be placed
forceEncrypt - if neither aliases nor password are specified, throw an exception (don't send plain text)
onCompletionSuccess - JavaScript to execute on success
onCompletionFailure - JavaScript to execute on failure

sendFileToUrl2

public void sendFileToUrl2(java.lang.String url,
                           java.lang.String prompt,
                           java.lang.String aliases,
                           java.lang.String password,
                           java.lang.String fileParameterName,
                           java.lang.String filenameParameterName,
                           java.lang.String form,
                           boolean sign,
                           java.lang.String signatureParameterName,
                           boolean forceEncrypt,
                           java.lang.String onCompletionSuccess,
                           java.lang.String onCompletionFailure)
Asynchronously copy a file to a URL. Displays a file selection dialog. Supports encryption and signing.

Identical to sendFileToUrl, except that it accepts the form parameter as a String in the format of a properties file.

Parameters:
url - the URL to which the file will be posted
prompt - the prompt to display in the file selection dialog
password - encrypt the file with this password (may be null)
aliases - encrypt the file to these public keys (may be null)
fileParameterName - the form variable in which the file will be placed
filenameParameterName - the form variable in which the file name will be placed
form - parameters to POST (ignored if method is not POST)
sign - sign the file with the current private key
signatureParameterName - the form variable in which the signature will be placed
forceEncrypt - if neither aliases nor password are specified, throw an exception (don't send plain text)
onCompletionSuccess - JavaScript to execute on success
onCompletionFailure - JavaScript to execute on failure

setAnonymous

public void setAnonymous(boolean anonymous)
When anonymous is true, no identifying information will be placed in outgoing encrypted messages, so they are suitable for BCC-ed messages.

Parameters:
anonymous - true or false (defaults to false)

Parameters:
alias - the alias to set
expirationTime - the expiration time in seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC or -1 to set it to the default value for the domain.

Returns:
a String representing the alias registered.

useArmor

public void useArmor(boolean useArmor)
Indicate whether or not the file encryption operations should use ASCII armoring. ASCII armoring will base-64 encode the encrypted data and add headers and footers indicating the message type. It will increase the size of the file, and reduce the speed of the encryption and decryption processes. ASCII armoring is off by default.

Parameters:
useArmor - true to turn armoring on, false to turn it off

usesArmor

public boolean usesArmor()
Indicates whether ASCII armoring for encryption to files is on or off.

Returns:
true if armoring is on, false if it is off

                          java.lang.String signature,
                          java.lang.String signer)
